item.title: AI Intern @ Tvam Technologies
item.description:
Role Overview

AI Intern | Sept 2025 – Present

I am currently an AI Intern at Tvam Technologies, responsible for fine-tuning language models and adapting them to the company’s unique needs and applications. As I progress in my role, I will also be working on creating and training new models.

Current Responsibilities

  • Fine-tuning language models using PEFT, LoRA, and hyperparameter tuning.
  • Preparing and preprocessing datasets: curation, cleaning, formatting, and prompt creation.
  • Designing custom data workflows to improve downstream model performance.
  • Conducting research through papers, articles, and benchmarks to guide experiments.
  • Strengthening fundamentals by learning Python from scratch through books and practice.
  • Preparing clear reports and documentation for experiments and results.
  • Planning to expand into model creation and architecture design as the internship progresses.

item.title: Teaching Assistant @ PES University

Role Overview

Python and Databases Teaching Assistant | Aug 2025 – Dec 2025

As a Teaching Assistant, I help bridge the gap between faculty instruction and student understanding, focusing on core computer science concepts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Mentorship: I mentor a cohort of 150+ undergraduate students, helping them grasp complex concepts in Python programming and Database Management Systems (DBMS).
  • Academic Support: My role involves assisting faculty in grading assignments, preparing course materials, and conducting interactive lab sessions where I help students debug code and understand database schemas in real-time.

item.title: Data Science Intern @ CODMAV (PES University)
item.description:
Role Overview

Data Science Intern | June 2024 – Aug 2024

My internship at the Centre of Data Modelling, Analytics and Visualization (CODMAV) was focused on healthcare analytics, specifically leveraging machine learning for early disease detection.

Key Projects

Lung Cancer Risk Prediction System

  • View GitHub Repository
  • Led the development of a Lung Cancer Risk Prediction System for early-stage risk assessment.
  • Data Preperation: Performed extensive data cleaning and preprocessing, including Random Forest based missing value imputation.
  • Dimensionality Reduction: I applied advanced feature selection techniques such as PCA (Principal Component Analysis), BSO, RFE (Recursive Feature Elimination), and SelectKBest to optimize the dataset for training.
  • The final feature set was validated by a doctor.
  • Model Development: Implemented and tuned multiple machine learning models including XGBoost, CatBoost, SVM, and KNN.
  • Results: Developed an Ensemble Model that combined the strengths of individual classifiers, achieving a peak accuracy of 98.75% and a recall of 96.25% for the RFE-selected features.

Research & Publication

  • Conducted in-depth research on Lung Cancer markers and ML techniques.
  • Co-authored a research paper titled “Predictive Analytics for Early Lung Cancer Risk using Machine Learning,” which was accepted and published in IEEE Xplore.
  • View Publication
